name: places/ChIJuxwTD2FYwokRERc2T5j1CL0
formattedAddress: 205 West End Ave #1f, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 205 West End Ave #1f, New York, NY 10023, USA

originalText.text:
Dr. Silivria is extremely thorough. She took time to get to know me as a new patient and did a complete exam, x-rays, and cleaning.  I didn't feel as though she was trying to rush me out the door as with other dentists. And the wait time was minimal, unlike other offices I've visited. In addition to my general dental health, she answered my questions about cosmetic options to improve my smile and tooth color.  She is very competent and cordial.  I am delighted to have her as my new general dentist and would highly recommend her to anyone seeking a good dentist.

On 10-26-2018, I went back to Dr. Silivria for my first follow-up appointment and continue to be very satisfied with the care I received. I was given x-rays and a full exam, which revealed a cavity that needed to be addressed.  After a thorough cleaning, my cavity was filled quickly and efficiently, and I have had no subsequent pain or discomfort.  I am happy to have a great general dentist here in the neighborhood.

originalText.text: Dr. Silivria is excellent. I had to have a cleaning, some fillings done and a crown finished. Dr. Silivria is very skilled, making the work quick, painless and easy. Her office staff is professional and organized. They follow the COVID-19 precautions thoroughly, unlike other dentist offices I have been to recently. Would highly recommend!

text.text: Dr. Silivria is excellent. I had to have a cleaning, some fillings done and a crown finished. Dr. Silivria is very skilled, making the work quick, painless and easy. Her office staff is professional and organized. They follow the COVID-19 precautions thoroughly, unlike other dentist offices I have been to recently. Would highly recommend!

originalText.text:
For me going to the dentist is a bit different than most people. I had a traumatic experience 5 years ago that has not just affected my life but my ability to bring myself to a dentist. So recently a crown broke and I had to find a dentist..a really good one....I did my homework and came up with a few in NYC...By fate or luck I ended up in Dr. Angelica Silivria chair.

I come from a family in healthcare.  Almost everyone in my immediate family is a surgeon, pharmacists, clinician, scientist or MD of some sort.  From a young age, I have been taught to inquire about any medical procedure being performed on me in painstaking details. Before meeting Dr Silivria , I met and rejected 3 dentist who were unable to demonstrate their knowledge to me sufficiently.  One of them is a Fifth Avenue celebrity dentist who has a 6 month waiting list  and charged me full price(no insurance accepted)  Still not good enough.  I do not care about a fancy office or equipment, if the knowledge and technique is lacking. When I met  Dr. Silivria for a consultation, not only was she extremely knowledgeable, she patiently tolerated my barrage of questions, answering calmly and precisely.  It was clear to me from that moment  if I ever became anxious in the chair during a procedure, she would provide the serenity I needed.

Dr. Silivria took a great conservative approach to my cavities and fillings and when I ended up requiring a root canal, with crown lengthening surgery, her staff squeezed me in for a quick checkup and referred me quickly to an periodontist for my surgery, and ensured my X-rays were sent over before I arrived to their office.  She is attentive, friendly, and very efficient.  She answers all of my questions before and after any appointment, and I find her to be incredibly knowledgeable.

Dr. Silivria sets herself apart from other NYC dentists by providing personalized and compassionate dental care. Her NYC dental office is staffed with highly trained dental care professionals.  Her office has also taken every precaution since COVID-19, highly recommended.

originalText.text: Dr Silivria is awesome. I dont have much free time in my schedule to go to the dentist but the highly professional front desk staff here make it easy with convenient appointments and no wait times. Dr Silivria is a skilled clinican and unlike many other docs around here she actually takes time and effort to educating her patients individually. I would highly recommend.

originalText.text: This BUSINESS was recommended to me and my partner by Nam Park DDS. I would, if possible, stay away from this BUSINESS. First of you are right, fluoride is not a heavy metal but it is a contaminant to the body and can be toxic to human health. Particularly, to your pineal gland… fluoride can cause brittle bones, weak teeth, white spots on teeth, neurological impairment, seizures, weakening of connecting tissue etc (I’m not going to do your research for you here the list is extensive). It’s extremely uncomfortable to get pushed by a dentist, especially one you are visiting for the first time, to do a procedure or suggest doing a procedure based on the average standard of care and disregarding everything your patient says. You need to learn to respect peoples chosen care and not guilt or pressure them into doing what YOU THINK is best based on what you DONT KNOW… it’s not your fault standard dentistry doesn’t even consider the effect of any of the treatment methods in the body. You don’t need to agree or understand my standard of care, but you need to respect it and if you cannot adjust or adapt to that then you have another thing coming for you because there’s ALOT of people who will refuse fluoride, fluoride mouthwash, unnecessary procedures and who won’t allow you to practice “standard care” which has gotten many people (including myself) sick. There’s no need to apologize either… what you were taught was wrong… just like we now know amalgam is toxic and does increase heavy metals in the body… the secretary was on the phone when I arrived speaking to insurance about a patient and the insurance was suggesting amalgam fillings….. like come on! Recognize that your practice needs change and if you can’t adapt then you won’t survive…Plain and simple.
